fa.name: fa-angle-double-left
fa.usage: Used to navigate to the first page of a multi-page data set

fa.name: fa-angle-double-right
fa.usage: Used to navigate to the last page of a multi-page data set

fa.name: fa-angle-down
fa.usage: Use for any expandable element, e.g. accordions, progressive disclosure, or expandable lists, to indicate that the element is currently expanded. Clicking will hide or collapse the element. Can also be used to expose full content when content is truncated

fa.name: fa-angle-left
fa.usage: Used to navigate to the previous page of a multi-page data set

fa.name: fa-angle-right
fa.usage: Use for any expandable element, e.g. accordions, progressive disclosure, or expandable lists, to indicate that the element is currently expanded. Clicking will hide or collapse the element. Also use to navigate to the next page in a multipage data set.

fa.name: fa-angle-up
fa.usage: Use for any expandable element, e.g. accordions, progressive disclosure, or expandable lists, to indicate that content is currently hidden. Clicking will show the element.

fa.name: fa-arrow-circle-o-down
fa.usage: An object is down, e.g. “VM is down”

fa.name: fa-arrow-circle-o-up
fa.usage: An object is up, e.g. “VM is up”

fa.name: fa-bell
fa.usage: Used in masthead for Notification Drawer alerts/notifications

fa.name: fa-bug
fa.usage: Indicates when there is a bug that needs to be fixed

fa.name: fa-check
fa.usage: For use in content views (e.g. table) to indicate OK status; As an action to accept changes

fa.name: fa-clock-o
fa.usage: Indicates time. If interactive, opens a timepicker control

fa.name: fa-cube
fa.usage: Indicates a container

fa.name: fa-cubes
fa.usage: Indicates a pod, or a number of pods

fa.name: fa-columns
fa.usage: To show/hide columns on a table view

fa.name: fa-database
fa.usage: Indicates a database

fa.name: fa-ellipsis-v
fa.usage: To show a menu of actions or additional actions when used on an action bar with other buttons

fa.name: fa-external-link
fa.usage: Indicates that a link goes to an external site

fa.name: fa-list
fa.usage: When selected, allows a user to view content in a list view

fa.name: fa-minus
fa.usage: Indicates that a user can subtract something

fa.name: fa-plus
fa.usage: Used for adding in UI; not for creating or adding new objects (see pficon-circle-add)

fa.name: fa-plus-square
fa.usage: Same as above; alternative to fa-plus

fa.name: fa-refresh
fa.usage: Indicates that the action to sync may be performed

fa.name: fa-sort-alpha-asc
fa.usage: For ordering a data set alphabetically (Ascending)

fa.name: fa-sort-alpha-desc
fa.usage: For ordering a data set alphabetically (Descending)

fa.name: fa-sort-asc
fa.usage: For ordering a data table column (Ascending)

fa.name: fa-sort-desc
fa.usage: For ordering a data table column (Descending)

fa.name: fa-sort-numeric-asc
fa.usage: For ordering a data set numerically (Ascending)

fa.name: fa-sort-numeric-desc
fa.usage: For ordering a data table set numerically (Descending)

fa.name: fa-sort
fa.usage: Associated with column sort in tables

fa.name: fa-table
fa.usage: When selected, allows a user to view content in a table view

fa.name: fa-tachometer
fa.usage: Indicates the presence of a dashboard view

fa.name: fa-th-large
fa.usage: When selected, allows a user to view content in a large card view

fa.name: fa-th
fa.usage: When selected, allows a user to view content in a small card view

pf.name: pficon-add-circle-o
pf.usage: Indicates that a user may create or add something

pf.name: pficon-arrow
pf.usage: Open in a new tab or window

pf.name: pficon-asleep
pf.usage: Object is asleep or in power suspended mode

pf.name: pficon-bundle
pf.usage: Indicates a package; used in Satellite, Cockpit and Composer to indicate a generic package, rpm

pf.name: pficon-catalog
pf.usage: Indicates a catalog/library that the user may browse or search through

pf.name: pficon-close
pf.usage: Allows a user to close out of a modal

pf.name: pficon-connected
pf.usage: Power is on and something is “up”; this is a more active alternative to “pficon-on”

pf.name: pficon-container-node
pf.usage: Indicates a container node or host

pf.name: pficon-disconnected
pf.usage: Power is off and something is “down”; this is a more active alternative to “pficon-off”

pf.name: pficon-edit
pf.usage: Indicates that something may be edited

pf.name: pficon-enhancement
pf.usage: Indicates that an enhancement advisory is present

pf.name: pficon-error-circle-o
pf.usage: Indicates that there is a major or critical error present

pf.name: pficon-export
pf.usage: Allows the user to export a file or other object

pf.name: pficon-filter
pf.usage: Allows a user to filter results or datasets

pf.name: pficon-help
pf.usage: Indicates that help may be found for a particular subject

pf.name: pficon-import
pf.usage: Allows the user to import a file or other object

pf.name: pficon-in-progress
pf.usage: the object in question has an action running (with an end goal)

pf.name: pficon-info
pf.usage: Indicates that more information may be found about a subject

pf.name: pficon-integration
pf.usage: Indicates an integration of two or more objects

pf.name: pficon-key
pf.usage: Used to reference an SSH key or something similar

pf.name: pficon-locked
pf.usage: Indicates that something is locked (for example, access)

pf.name: pficon-maintenance
pf.usage: VM or other object is currently preparing for maintenance

pf.name: pficon-memory
pf.usage: Indicates the memory of a device

pf.name: pficon-migration
pf.usage: VM or other object is in the middle of a migration

pf.name: pficon-on-running
pf.usage: x is on/up and also running/active

pf.name: pficon-optimize
pf.usage: Indicates the suggestion to optimize, or the ability to optimize a process

pf.name: pficon-paused
pf.usage: VM or other object is paused. (The processor execution is stopped at whatever point the process was in)

pf.name: pficon-pending
pf.usage: x is pending; currently waiting on contingencies

pf.name: pficon-print
pf.usage: Indicates that a user may print content

pf.name: pficon-restart
pf.usage: x is currently restarting or rebooting

pf.name: pficon-save
pf.usage: Save a file or other object

pf.name: pficon-search
pf.usage: Indicates that that user may perform a search

pf.name: pficon-security
pf.usage: Indicates the presence of a security advisory

pf.name: pficon-settings
pf.usage: Indicates that settings may be changed by a user

pf.name: pficon-sort-common-asc
pf.usage: Used to communicate a smallest-to-largest sort order for non-numerical and non-alphabetized data types. May be used to sort by size, by date, by distance… etc.

pf.name: pficon-sort-common-desc
pf.usage: Used to communicate a largest-to-smallest sort order for non-numerical and non-alphabetized data types. May be used to sort by size, by date, by distance… etc.

pf.name: pficon-spinner2
pf.usage: Indicates the ability to refresh. Please use this animated spinner to indicate that something is “loading” or in the middle of processing

pf.name: pficon-template
pf.usage: A set of contents or instructions that are used to generate one or more instances of a final output.

pf.name: pficon-topology
pf.usage: When selected, allows a user to view content in a topology view

pf.name: pficon-unlocked
pf.usage: Indicates that something is unlocked (for example, access)

pf.name: pficon-user
pf.usage: Indicates a user (often in the masthead, preceding a username)

pf.name: pficon-warning-triangle-o
pf.usage: Indicates that there is a warning. This is not to be confused with an error.

pf.name: pficon-zone
pf.usage: Indicates a zone; a grouping of servers based on geographic location, network location, or function
